column4: ok, i've got a dir chmodded to 775, and i am a member of the group that owns the dir, yet i cannot write to it.  whats the deal?
just a user folder on a secondary drive
i have. the dir is chowned to the group
thats why i dont get it...
You must have sudo in front of it!!!
Or you can use sudo su
why? i'm a member of the group...
i should have write access by way of permissions
It's usually required, commands like that need sudo
why in the world would copying a file to a directory that is owned by a group that i'm a member of require sudo?
that will obviously work, but i'm wanting to write the files as myself... not root
